entry.title: Re: SAP S4/HANA Cloud Public, G/L account hierarchy 1799...
entry.content:
Hello @rekafulop 

Thank you for your update regarding the creation of FSV 1799 and the balance validation issues, and my apologies for the late reply

To address the problem, please ensure the following.

  • Please double-check that the balance validation rules are properly set up and active for FSV 1799 in the Manage Balance Validation Rules and Groups app. This helps ensure everything runs smoothly.
  • Make sure all rule details, like ledger, company code, account ranges, and currency, match your settings and postings to keep everything in sync.
  • Please double-check that the posting data for the relevant entities and periods are available and complete. Missing data might lead to validation errors, so it's good to ensure everything is in place.
  • Review the consistency of the review period and ledger with the FSV configuration.
  • If applicable, take a moment to check for any specific FSV settings, like row grouping, that could influence how balance validation is processed. This little step can help ensure everything runs smoothly!

For additional help, feel free to check out these helpful SAP resources.

  • View Balance Validation Results app documentation, which helps analyse validation results and failure reasons.
  • Manage Balance Validation Rules and Groups app for configuring and activating rules.

If problems persist, please provide the specific error messages, and we'll help with further diagnosis.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Train-The-Trainer SAP Datasphere in Spanish by Marcela Revilla - Sponsored by UA
entry.content:
About this event

Within the training, the current status of SAP Datasphere as a representative of a Cloud Native will be presented and the application scenarios will be discussed.

Content

  • SAP Datasphere introduction
  • Overview of current functionality
  • Case Study: Basic Concepts of SAP Datasphere
  • Optional: Case Study: Merge Scenario in SAP Datasphere
  • Optional: Special features of the teaching environment
  • Outlook on future functionality

Our experienced instructors will teach you the most important content for use in teaching.

Participation is free of charge. Registration is only possible for lecturers at educational institutions with a valid academic email address.

Dates and times

23 & 24 October, Thursday and Friday, 8-12 h MX 

Registration via this zoom link

The online training takes place with a minimum of 7 participants.

This training has been sponsored by SAP UA

entry.title: Train-The-Trainer SAP Integrated Business Planning in Spanish by Marcela Revilla - Sponsored by UA
entry.content:
About this event

Within the training, the current status of SAP IBP (Successor of SAP SCM) is presented with a focus on Demand Planning (DP) and Sales and Operations Planning (S&OP).

Content

  1. Introduction to SAP IBP [approx. 2h].
  2. results of the evaluation phase [approx. 2h]
  3. pilot environment and pilot project [approx. 2h].

Our experienced lecturers will teach you the most important contents for use in teaching.

Participation is free of charge. Registration is only possible for lecturers at educational institutions with a valid academic email address.

Date & time

November 13 & 14, Thursday & Friday. 8-12 h MX 

Registration via this zoom link 

The online training takes place with a minimum of 7 participants.

This training has been sponsored by SAP UA

entry.title: Re: MTD and Advanced Compliance Reporting
entry.content:
Hi @GLENT 

Thank you for your message. Let me walk you through.

Please note, HMRC does provide a sandbox/test environment for Making Tax Digital VAT submissions that authorized software providers can use to test integrations. You need to register a test user on the HMRC Developer Hub to get your test credentials. Using these will enable you simulate the desired VAT obligation requests and submissions via the sandbox. This allows you to validate processes before going live.


Once a return period is submitted to HMRC, it is generally locked for further changes. If transactions are posted late HMRC expects these to be reflected in the next open return period, not the locked prior one. So effectively, ‘backpostings’ should flow into the next available return period to maintain compliance and audit trail integrity.


Posting Postponed VAT Accounting without manual adjustments on the VAT return boxes is challenging as VAT returns usually require specific box adjustments that SAP standard processes often don’t automate fully. While manual box adjustments are common, please note that they lack detailed audit trails in SAP S/4HANA. Some businesses deploy custom developments or enhanced reporting to strengthen audit capabilities around VAT box postings and adjustments.

I hope this provides some useful insights. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: CORS for SAP PO REST Sender Adapter
entry.content:
@RodolfoTorrado 


"Allow public access" - Check the box
"Allow cross site requests" - Select "Allow only specific clients"
"CORS enabled URIs)" - Add whatever is shown in "from origin" in your error message, including the port number.

Example https://xyz-mycompany.com:8080, https://mycompany.com etc. (comma separated list)

When configuring CORS policies, you must ensure that the allowed origins (domain) include the correct port number if it deviates from the default ports (80 for HTTP and 443 for HTTPS)

Hope this helps

entry.title: मैं मीशो में शिकायत कैसे दर्ज करूँ?
entry.content: कस्टमर केयर नंबर का उपयोग करके शिपिंग के बाद मीशो पर ऑर्डर रद्द करें आप ऐप के माध्यम से मीशो पर शिप किए गए ऑर्डर को भी रद्द कर सकते हैं। शिप किए गए संदेश प्रदर्शित होने के बाद मीशो में ऑर्डर रद्द करने का तरीका इस प्रकार है: आप उनके हेल्पलाइन नंबर 91 7219°872°651 पर डायल कर सकते हैं।

entry.title: Re: Company DB is not consistent; see log [Message 131-21...
entry.content:
Hello @Joo_Leo 

Thank you for your question

When updating the database from version 2111 to 2505, an error occurs: Company DB is not consistent. This is indicated in log Message 131-219, which indicates a database inconsistency caused by an incomplete or failed upgrade.

Direct Solution:

  • Check the upgrade log files for specific errors.
  • Verify the database schema version matches the application version.
  • If inconsistency persists, restore the database from a backup before the upgrade and rerun the update.
  • Contact SAP support if the issue persists to prevent data loss.

References for troubleshooting and resolution:

  1. The SAP Community guide on Company DB is not consistent with the error.
  2. SAP Business One Administrator's Guide for upgrade procedures and error handling.

This approach helps you address the root cause effectively and with confidence.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Documentation for DDIC tables of the DRC module
entry.content:
Hi @martin_lehmann4 

Thank you for your question. 

Regarding your requirement to display VAT return transactions from both DRC and FI-GL-GL-F content in a single custom query, here are a few details and suggestions.

The main DRC table you identified is SRF_REP_RUN_DATA, which holds data for statutory reporting.

Unfortunately, SAP documentation on linking SRF_REP_RUN_DATA to individual transactions is limited to a large extent.

Please note that, typically, SRF_REP_RUN_DATA stores aggregated or processed reporting data rather than raw transactional line items.

For FI-GL-GL-F data, tables like FOTTDCLNOT and FOTDECLSTA hold declaration and status information as you mentioned.

Moving forward, i suggest you explore SAP legal reporting framework or statutory reporting frameworks where these data sources may be linked through reporting layers or views.

It might also be of help to review SAP program logs or report generation logic that populates SRF_REP_RUN_DATA for clues on field mappings.

You may consider engaging SAP support or consulting legal reporting experts for detailed guidance on DRC table usage and extensions.

Looking into your custom query, joining DRC aggregated data with detailed FI transactional tables may require custom logic or mapping tables because it is not a straightforward link.

I hope this helps you solve the issue. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Integration suite unsubscription failed
entry.content:
Hello @FranckMebal 

Thank you for reaching out. The "Unsubscription Failed" error you encountered in your SAP Integration Suite trial account typically occurs due to temporary service disruptions or restrictions within the trial environment.

Please try the following steps:

  • Wait a few moments and try again to unsubscribe.
  • Clear your browser's cache and cookies or try using a different browser.
  • Make sure you have the correct permissions to manage subscriptions during your trial account.

For more detailed guidance, please refer to the SAP Integration Suite documentation on the SAP Help Portal and the SAP Community topic on Integration Suite:

  • SAP Help Portal: https://help.sap.com/viewer/product/ SAP_INTEGRATION_SUITE
  • SAP Community: https://community.sap.com/topics/integration-suite

Please do not hesitate to contact me if you require any further assistance.

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Navigating the Future: Understanding Upcoming Changes to SAP Universal ID
entry.content:
@Akhat_12 could you please clarify how the future authentication will work in detail? 

In your post you wrote: 

Instead, authentication will now require an email address and a dedicated password.

But today the SAP UID is an e-mail address with a password. So I do not see where this would be any change. Furthermore, on the following page https://www.sap.com/account/universal-id.html?sap-outbound-id=6BF4E20C2BE9A25208F18487FE01DED3C49BD508&smc_campaign_id=0000050180&source=email-smc it is written that authentication would be done with a dedicated user identity which is by my understanding an S-, P- or C-User, contradicting your statement. 

I would also like to get a clarification how the authentication to the SAP UID account manager will work in future. Will this also be identity (S-User) based, which would finally allow us to activate state of the art authentication methods like two factor authentication or is this still using the UID e-mail and password combo which we highlighted as a security risk months ago without any action from SAP?

entry.title: Re: Datasphere, SAP BPT Core Account
entry.content:
Hello @FelipeCadena @afonso_figueiredo 

Thank you for your question and I hope you both can still make use of this answer.

To change your subaccount entry in the SAP BTP Core Account section in Datasphere:

Go to the System / Administration area in Datasphere. Then navigate to the Data Source Configuration tab where you see the SAP BTP Core Account details. Unfortunately, the Email and Subaccount fields once entered are often not directly editable from this screen.

To correct a mistaken subaccount, there are a few steps you should consider:

First, you may need to remove or unregister the current SAP BTP Core Account connection.

Then re-register or add a new SAP BTP Core Account with the correct subaccount information.

Alternatively, you can check if there is a Change Cloud Platform User or similar button available to update your SAP BTP connection.

Please note, if the UI does not support direct change, delete and recreate the connection with your correct subaccount.

Please also verify in the SAP BTP Cockpit that you are using the intended subaccount and region matching what you configure in Datasphere.

I hope this helps you solve the issue. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: How can I remove the link between an existing production order and its related sales order in the SA
entry.content:
Hello everybody,

entry.title: Re: How can i pass Fiscal Period from SAC Report to a que...
entry.content:
Hi @IndraGhosh @Sachin_Prabhudesai7 

Thank you for your question. Let me walk you through.

The issue often arises due to format mismatches. Please note that SAP fiscal periods usually follow a unique format like 012/2021 where 012 is the fiscal period with leading zeros and slash separating year and this differs from typical calendar month formats such as 12/2021.

To solve that issue, I suggest you consider the following:

First, ensure to transform the fiscal year period value in SAC before passing it through the hyperlink. For example, you should split or extract the period part from fiscal year string and reformat it into a date or calendar month format compatible with the S/4HANA query prompt.

Then you can create a calculated column in your SAC model or story that converts 012/2021 into something like 12/2021 or a proper date recognized by the query.

Thereafter, make sure you use this transformed field in the hyperlink parameters so S/4HANA query prompt accepts it without format errors.

The suggested workaround aligns SAC fiscal period formatting with S/4HANA Public Cloud query expected input and resolves the format mismatch errors.

I hope this helps you solve the issue. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: SAP Datasphere: SQL or Graphical Views?
entry.content:
Making an Educated Decision

In today’s data-driven world, SAP Datasphere empowers businesses to seamlessly connect, prepare, and manage their data. Among its many capabilities, views play a central role in combining local or remote tables, enriching datasets, and creating meaningful insights.

But when it comes to building these views, SAP Datasphere offers two powerful approaches: Graphical Views and SQL Views.

which one should you choose? Let’s break it down.

1. Understanding Views in SAP Datasphere

Views are essential components that allow you to:

  • Combine data from multiple sources (local or remote tables).
  • Link, filter, and enrich datasets.
  • Rename or remove columns to simplify models.
  • Add calculated columns and custom logic.

This flexibility makes views a cornerstone of data modeling in SAP Datasphere.

2. Understanding Graphical Views

Graphical Views in SAP Datasphere enable you to prepare and model data without requiring any prior knowledge of SQL. Using an intuitive drag-and-drop interface, both business users and non-technical professionals can easily create and manage views.

 

 

With graphical views, you can:

  • Seamlessly add and combine multiple data sources.
  • Join, filter, and enrich your datasets with just a few clicks.
  • Rearrange, rename, or exclude columns to simplify your models.
  • Create calculated columns and perform aggregations effortlessly.
  • Build unions and refine data flows visually.

If necessary, you can generate and display the corresponding SQL statement via the menu path Edit → Export → Preview SQL. This way, graphical views can be used as a template for the SQL views.

3. Understanding SQL Views

SQL Views in SAP Datasphere provide a powerful and flexible way to model data using SQLScript. They are ideal for scenarios that require advanced transformations, complex logic, and fine-grained control over your data.

 

With SQL Views, you can:

  • Gain full control over data transformations and modeling logic.
  • Utilize advanced SQL functions and implement conditional statements.
  • Integrate multiple layers of business rules directly into your data models.
  • Optimize queries and improve system performance.

SQL Views are typically preferred by developers and data engineers, as they offer the depth and flexibility needed for complex scenarios.

Best Use Cases:

  • When your data modeling involves complex transformations that go beyond the capabilities of graphical views.
  • For situations where performance optimization is a top priority.

When you need precise control over every detail of your SQL-based logic.

4. When to Combine Both: Mixed Scenarios

In some cases, the best solution is not choosing between the two but combining them:

  • Use Graphical Views to handle simpler joins and aggregations.
  • Enhance them by embedding SQL logic for advanced calculations.
  • Enrich functions written in SQLScript directly within the graphical interface.

This hybrid approach ensures scalability, flexibility, and performance optimization.

5. Key Differences Between Graphical and SQL Views

  • Graphical Views offer a visual, drag-and-drop interface designed for business users and non-technical teams. They simplify joins, filters, and aggregations without requiring SQL knowledge and are less error-prone.
  • SQL Views provide greater flexibility and advanced customization, ideal for developers and data engineers. With SQLScript, you can handle complex transformations, use subqueries, and apply window functions for optimized data modeling.
  • While Graphical Views are faster for beginners, SQL Views are often quicker, easier to maintain, and reusable for experienced developers.

6. Use Cases and Best Practices

  • For complex, evolving data models that require frequent updates, SQL Views are the better choice. They are easier to read, simpler to maintain, and more scalable over time.
  • If you currently rely on Graphical Views for these scenarios, consider migrating early. Although you can export graphical views to SQL, the generated code is often hard to read and requires manual adjustments.
  • When using SQL Views, follow best practices for readable SQLScript and optimized performance to ensure smooth maintenance.

Conclusion

Choosing between Graphical Views and SQL Views in SAP Datasphere depends on your business needs, team expertise, and data complexity.

  • If you want simplicity and speed, go for Graphical Views.

  • If you need advanced customization and performance control, SQL Views are your best bet.

  • And when in doubt? Mix both approaches to leverage the strengths of each.

By making an educated decision, you can optimize your data modeling process and unlock the full potential of SAP Datasphere.

entry.title: SAP Developer News August 21st, 2025
entry.content:
DESCRIPTION 

PODCAST: https://podcast.opensap.info/sap-developers/2025/08/21/sap-developer-news-august-21st-2025/ 

ABAP Extensibility Guide – Clean core extensibility whitepaper 

  • Clean core extensibility whitepaper: https://d.dam.sap.com/a/juG2xVj/Clean_core_extensibility_white_paper_Final8.pdf?rc=10&inline=true 
  • SAP News: https://news.sap.com/2025/08/extend-sap-s4hana-cloud-right-way-clean-clear/ 
  • Blogpost: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/why-clean-core-matters-get-some-insights-into-the-about-our-brand-new/ba-p/14163750 
  • Blogpost: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/abap-extensibility-guide-clean-core-for-sap-s-4hana-cloud-august-2025/ba-p/14175399 
  • ABAP extensibility guide: https://www.sap.com/documents/2022/10/52e0cd9b-497e-0010-bca6-c68f7e60039b.html 

CAP July 2025 Release 

  • Release notes https://cap.cloud.sap/docs/releases/july25 
  • The Art and Science of CAP series https://qmacro.org/blog/posts/2024/12/06/the-art-and-science-of-cap/  
  • The code is in the framework, not outside of it https://qmacro.org/blog/posts/2024/11/07/five-reasons-to-use-cap/#1-the-code-is-in-the-framework-not-outside-of-it  
  • A modern and clean Neovim setup for CAP Node.js - configuration and diagnostics (CAP Language Server configuration with Neovim 0.11) https://qmacro.org/blog/posts/2025/06/10/a-modern-and-clean-neovim-setup-for-cap-node.js-configuration-and-diagnostics/  

SAP BTP ABAP Environment – New software delivery option “Add-On Product” 

  • Blogpost https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/sap-btp-abap-environment-new-software-delivery-option-add-on-product/ba-p/14094161  
  • Partner Portal https://partneredge.sap.com/en/welcome.html?pexpRequestedURL=%2Fen.html  
  • Technical Information - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Pxb8NSAS9Vc  

Extensibility Assistant 

  • Help document: https://help.sap.com/docs/abap-ai/generative-ai-in-abap-cloud/genai-driven-extensibility-assistant?locale=en-US 

ABAP Development Tools (ADT) Survey 

  • Survey link: https://sapinsights.eu.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_7X5P63Zg5zXC5zE?product=ABAP%20Development%20Tools%20(ADT)&product_filter=ADT 
  • LinkedIn post: https://www.linkedin.com/posts/iwonahahn_abap-abapcloud-adt-activity-7363133699854372864-CrZz?utm_source=share&utm_medium=member_desktop&rcm=ACoAAAWof-gBG-2LX6IEfsvBmH1nqBpjCl3XF-k 

 

CHAPTER TITLES  

0:00 Intro 

0:10 ABAP Extensibility Guide – Clean core extensibility whitepaper 

1:54 CAP July 2025 Release 

6:22 SAP BTP ABAP Environment – New software delivery option “Add-On Product” 

7:51 Extensibility Assistant 

8:23 ABAP Development Tools (ADT) Survey 

 

TRANSCRIPTION

[Intro] This is the SAP Developer News for August the 21st, 2025.

[Shilpa] Hello, ABAP developers. You might have already been aware of the ABAP Extensibility Guide, which gives the overview of ABAP Cloud Development Model and ABAP-based extensibility options for both SAP S4 HANA in the cloud and on-premise. The key concept of extensibility outlined in this guide is the three-tier extensibility model. This model describes how ABAP Cloud and classic ABAP can coexist within a same system. The new Clean Core Extensibility White Paper introduced by SAP incorporates evolution of the current three-tier extensibility model to the Clean Core Level concept. The new maturity model categorizes extensions into four distinct levels, A, B, C, and D, based on the architecture, integrity, upgrade safety, and alignment with Clean Core principles. Now each extension is evaluated using a standardized methodology that looks at how the extension is built, how well it is decoupled from the core, and how easily it can be upgraded or maintained. Level A is extend with SAP build, either side-by-side or on stack. Level B is leverage, classic APIs. Level C, accessing the internal objects. And level D, not recommended of extensions. So, by distinguishing between these levels, it enables businesses to make informed development decisions, prioritize the higher risk extensions, and ensure it's compliant with CleanCore principle. It supports transparent decision-making regarding where to invest in cleanup, modernization, or new development. I will leave the link of the Extensibility Guide, CleanCore Extensibility Whitepaper, and the blog post in the description. Check it out.

[DJ] As you may have seen already in the release notes section of CAP hire the official cap documentation the July 2025 release of CAP is out all the details from this release can be found on the relevant release notes page but let me give you the highlights first there are a couple of items in the general category you can now provide custom validation messages when you use any of the Assert Range, Assert Format, or mandatory annotations in your CDS model. And of course, using internationalization bundles, you can provide language-specific variants for those custom messages. We've seen the growth and maturing of CAP's support for Fiori TreeViews over the recent months, and with this July release, that support is now GA, generally available with lots of features out of the box and more to come. Now in the Node.js category there's improved reference documentation for the subject property of a request object and if you're wondering what that is it's a query in CQN and if you want to learn more about this fundamental building block of CAP check out the Art and Science of CAP series with me and Daniel Hudson. If you're migrating from XSUAA to IAS you'll be happy to know that CAP IAS strategy automatically supports XSUAA tokens as long as you have the necessary bindings in place. Of course that means you can configure your requirements like this for a win-win. Also work on signature and token decode caches has also been carried out in relation to configuration of token caching with the SAPXSSEC package. And last but certainly not least in this Node.js category, if you provide numeric values in your CSV files they are now honored as such as opposed to strings. If you do want them as strings just prefix them with zeros or of course just enclose them in quotes. Now in the Java category you can now get the framework to do even more for you, even more work in the area of generic exception handling for empty results .single queries. This means less boilerplate, less code for you to write and maintain following one of CAP's enduring philosophical drivers. And talking of writing less code and streamlining the code that you do write, the draft service API is now simpler, meaning you can update and delete draft-enabled entities in a more uniform way bringing it more in line with how you manage non-draft-enabled entities. Finally in the Java category there are now improvements in how expand restrictions are checked by the runtime, this can be enabled in configuration and with the annotations you can control expands generally and expansion levels in particular. And there are updates in the tools category too. There's a new facet available in the CDS add command that facet is GHA, so with cds add gha you can quickly set up a GitHub Actions workflow for deployment, for example to Cloud Foundry, and in the area of, in my opinion, amazing and already well-accomplished language support mechanisms for CAM in the form of the language server and related facilities, there are new formatting options providing fine-grained control over space surrounding codons and also an experimental addition to the language server offerings in the form of go-to implementations. Check it out in VS Code, of course, or if you're that way inclined, like me, in NeoVim, where it works too, especially via the LSP integration configuration in Xero LM. Happy capping.

[M K Sheena] Today, we have an exciting update for partners working with SAP BTP ABAP Environment or Steampunk. Nora Clem in her latest blog post explains the new software delivery option called Add-on Product. So partners now have two ways to deliver solutions to customers. First is as a multi-tenant SaaS solution or service offering where partners fully manage development, production, and operations, and customers can adapt it using key user extensibility. Second is a new option as a software offering called Add-on Product, which is ideal for customers who want to run the solution in their own environment or need developer extensibility. It is delivered via the SAP Store, installed and operated by the customers. Partners can use a hybrid delivery model, SaaS plus Add-on, but delivering Add-on Products requires the SAP Partner Edge Build Track, which also provides rich resources, tools, and training. Add-on Products follow the same initial build process as SaaS solutions, but require registration in Solution Hub, PE Build Contract, and optional certification for quality assurance. Customers must complete a one-time amendment process depending on contract date before Add-on Products can be installed and managed via the Landscape Portal. The links for more technical information about the Add-on Product and SAP Partner Portal and the blog posts are available in the description box below to check it out.

[Shilpa] Hey, I'm not gone yet. GenAI-driven Extensibility Assistant is now live. It can answer questions related to field extensibility and field logic. It can assist you in various tasks related to field extensibility, including creating custom fields, finding business context for extending ADS, services, APIs, or transactions. And you can also find the usage where the custom fields are used, finding value helps, and finding bodies. Check out the details in the help document, which I will leave in the description.

[Ajay] Hello developers, there's some good news for ABAP developers. Users who have been using ABAP development tools for a while can now participate in a new survey which is available and they can provide their valuable feedback. Those could be on the area of usability issues or the areas where the tool needs improvement, and you could also suggest what you would like to see in the tool in future. So this would be a very valuable inclination for the ADT developers and they would be more than happy to receive direct feedback from you. But this would also drive the future roadmap of the tool. So I encourage you to head over to the survey and provide your valuable feedback. The link to the survey will be provided in the description below.

entry.title: पेटीएम गलत लेनदेन नंबर

entry.title: Re: IPS Systems
entry.content:
Hi @tskwin 

Regarding your question there are a few points to highlight.

Please note that Keycloak is not officially listed among supported systems for SAP Cloud Identity Services but IPS supports integration with various non-SAP systems using standards like SCIM.

Using an unsupported system like Keycloak generally does not incur additional licensing costs beyond your existing SAP Cloud Identity Services subscriptions.

SAP licenses IAS and IPS typically cover provisioning to and from supported and standard-compliant systems. There is no separate fee specifically for connecting non-listed systems.

However, integration complexity or need for custom development may be higher and SAP support may be limited.

It is advisable to confirm with SAP sales or your SAP account manager for your contract specifics.

Also, ensure your usage complies with SAP’s standard licensing terms outlined in your agreements.

In summary, while Keycloak integration is possible without extra licensing fees, it is prudent to verify exact licensing with SAP based on your contract.

I hope this helps you solve the issue. I am happy to help if you have further questions.
